sense.name: create a representation or model of
sense.examples: We modeled the effects of the introduction of a herbicide-resistant sugar. He modeled the dog in clay. The Darwin Project will model how marine microbes live and evolve in the global ocean.

sense.name: create in imitation of
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] MODEL NP2[patient] PP Includes: MODEL ON, MODEL AFTER, MODEL ALONG
sense.examples: They modeled their TNN show after 1950s TV variety programs. They modeled their imperial methods on the Portuguese. He often called St Francis of Assisi his hero and modeled his life after him. He identified with the pseudo-aristocratic lifestyle, and in fact modeled his home along those lines.

sense.name: display objects or oneself by using or posing
sense.examples: Who modeled for that picture? She made a lot of money modeling nailpolish for magazine ads. He jumped out of his vehicle and modeled his attire in the roadway.
